  • City Council
  • Fejeran, Eric

Fejeran, Eric

(509) 338-3195

With deep roots in Pullman, Eric has been an active community member for years. His journey has been defined by his efforts to bring the community closer together over common causes, exemplified by championing Dolly Parton's Imagination Library during his tenure as Executive Director of United Way of Whitman County. Eric's unique perspective gained from working at Washington State University's Financial Aid Office has equipped him to address the challenges faced by students. As a City Council member, Eric is dedicated to fostering inclusivity, improving infrastructure, and addressing housing needs to create a more equitable Pullman where residents feel a sense of ownership over the policies that affect them.

Eric initially came to Pullman for school at WSU in 2008 but quickly discovered the city's hidden treasures. He resides on Military Hill with his husband Brad of nine years. In his leisure time, Eric enjoys exercising at the aquatic center and partaking in pub trivia nights at Paradise Creek Brewery's Trailside Taproom. Eric is committed to serving the Pullman community, ensuring every resident's voice is heard in the city he proudly calls home. He eagerly anticipates the journey ahead, working collaboratively with the people of Pullman to shape a brighter future.
